body:
Please load latest daily build from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell and check again.
GitHub
GitHub - PowerShell/PowerShell: PowerShell for every system!
PowerShell for every system! Contribute to PowerShell/PowerShell development by creating an account on GitHub.

I tested with the latest daily as suggested.  The results were the same when using the commands I showed above for recreating the condition.  

With more testing today, I found that **this only occurs if the length of one of the directories is exactly equal to MAX_PATH**.  _Anything less or greater does not result in this issue_.  It just so happens that the C:\ProgramData structure I first found this with, as well as the example folder I created above, had a path where one of the child folders came to exactly 260 chars.  I updated the title today of this issue to better indicate the problem.

I created a quick script that can be used to show this in action, and allow easily running from different PS versions called "ShowPSH_Bug.ps1" with the contents listed below:

# "ShowPSH_Bug.ps1"
```
# Show the PowerShell Version
$PSVersionTable.PSVersion.ToString()

# Pick top level to create test folder
$Base = $ENV:USERPROFILE
# Generate name for long test folder to create that is close to MAX_PATH, but under, leaving room to create child folders
$FoldParent = "A" * (260 - $Base.Length - 9 - 2)  # 9 = "Fold03Bad" length and 2 = 2x "\"

# Create test folder structure, with a "SubFolder" underneath each test child folder
Cmd.exe /C MkDir "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent\Fold01Good\SubFolder"	# Parent of "SubFolder" Will be 261 chars long
Cmd.exe /C MkDir "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent\Fold02Good02"	        # Folder Will be 263 chars long - No subfolders created
Cmd.exe /C MkDir "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent\Fold03OK\SubFolder"	# Parent of "SubFolder" Will be 259 chars long
Cmd.exe /C MkDir "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent\Fold04Bad\SubFolder"	# Parent of "SubFolder" Will be exactly 260 chars long (MAX_PATH) - This will be the problematic one!
Cmd.exe /C MkDir "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent\Fold05___OK\SubFolder"	# Parent of "SubFolder" Will be 262 chars long

# Now Perform First Test - Simply Using Get-ChildItem To Display The Output
Write-Host("`r`nTest One: gci")
# With PSH 7.2 preview 9 and newer this bombs out right when enumerating the "Fold04Bad" folder
Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue "$Base\$FoldParent"

# Now Perform Second Test - Using Get-ChildItem Piping To ForEach-Object
Write-Host("`r`nTest Two: gci + ForEach")
Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -Path "$Base\$FoldParent" | ForEach-Object {
	# With PSH 7.2 preview 9 and newer this bombs out right when enumerating the "Fold04Bad" folder, aborting the ForEach, and ignoring the ErrorAction
	"Curr Folder: $($_.Name)"
}

# Remove the test folder structure
Write-Host("Removing test folder structure...")
Cmd.exe /C RD /S /Q "\\?\$Base\$FoldParent"

```

I ran that script above in several PS versions, and pasted results below to show how the latest preview 9 and newer seem to have introduced an issue when this scenario occurs.
 
# Output for PowerShell 7.2 preview 8 (I also validated PowerShell 7.1.4 matched this) 

```
PS C:\> Z:\ShowPSH_Bug.ps1
7.2.0-preview.8

Test One: gci

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                Fold01Good
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                Fold02Good02
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                Fold03OK
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                Fold04Bad
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                Fold05___OK

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold01Good

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                SubFolder

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold03OK

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                SubFolder

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold04Bad

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                SubFolder

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold05___OK

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:55                SubFolder

Test Two: gci + ForEach
Curr Folder: Fold01Good
Curr Folder: Fold02Good02
Curr Folder: Fold03OK
Curr Folder: Fold04Bad
Curr Folder: Fold05___OK
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Removing test folder structure...

PS C:\>
```




# Output for PowerShell 7.2 preview 9 and newer including latest daily
```

PS C:\> Z:\ShowPSH_Bug.ps1
7.2.0-daily20210923.1

Test One: gci

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold01Good
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold02Good02
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold03OK
d----          2021.09.25    01:56
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold05___OK

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold01Good

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                SubFolder

    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA\Fold03OK

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                SubFolder
Get-ChildItem: Z:\ShowPSH_Bug.ps1:19
Line |
  19 |  Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue "$Base\$F …
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The system cannot find the path specified.


Test Two: gci + ForEach
Curr Folder: Fold01Good
Curr Folder: Fold02Good02
Curr Folder: Fold03OK
Curr Folder: Fold04Bad
Curr Folder: Fold05___OK
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Curr Folder: SubFolder
Get-ChildItem: Z:\ShowPSH_Bug.ps1:23
Line |
  23 |  Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -Path "$B …
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The system cannot find the path specified.

Removing test folder structure...

PS C:\>

```

Above it can be seen that preview 9 and newer abort when attempting to enumerate the "Fold04Bad" folder structure for the simple gci recurse operation.  
Notice also in the fist part of the gci output above, where it lists the first set of folders before it starts recursing, that the listing has the placeholder with date/time stamp for the "Fold04Bad" folder, but _the name is missing from the list_... as seen in this excerpt here:

```
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold03OK
d----          2021.09.25    01:56
d----          2021.09.25    01:56                Fold05___OK

```

When attempting to pipe the gci to ForEach-Object, the failure completely aborts seemingly ignoring the specified ErrorAction, making the error more of a terminating error vs non-terminating.


# PS 5.1 Behavior
It should be noted that PS 5.1 does not enumerate the folders longer than MAX_PATH.  However, as long as I use the ErrorAction shown, it at least continues with the operation and does not abort it:


```
PS C:\> Z:\ShowPSH_Bug.ps1
5.1.19041.1237

Test One: gci


    Directory: C:\Users\matt\AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
    AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA


Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d-----        2021.09.25     02:21                Fold01Good
d-----        2021.09.25     02:21                Fold02Good02
d-----        2021.09.25     02:21                Fold03OK
d-----        2021.09.25     02:21                Fold04Bad
d-----        2021.09.25     02:21                Fold05___OK

Test Two: gci + ForEach
Curr Folder: Fold01Good
Curr Folder: Fold02Good02
Curr Folder: Fold03OK
Curr Folder: Fold04Bad
Curr Folder: Fold05___OK
Removing test folder structure...


PS C:\>
```

To confirm I removed the -ErrorAction and ran again in 5.1..  Where I saw an error displayed for each folder as it tried to enumerate...  However it still didn't completely abort the operation trying either as seen with preview 9 and newer of 7.2.

@BouwenMA Thanks for your investigations!

The fix is easy. In:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/3ed7571f94705a81b861efca7854dbcd9c2225bd/src/System.Management.Automation/namespaces/FileSystemProvider.cs#L8270-L8273
we should replace the condition with `if (fullPath.Length >= MAX_PATH)`.

:tada:This issue was addressed in #16487, which has now been successfully released as `v7.3.0-preview.1`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.3.0-preview.1)
